what: Database connection for storing chat data
title: Getting started with shinyChatR
text: using database connection store chat messages, need initialize database table using chat module. following example shows example using DBI RSQLite packages. Replace db_file path database file. data saved table chat_data. Now can add chat module app:
code: library(DBI) library(RSQLite)  db_file <- "path_to_your_database_file" conn <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), db_file)  # initiate chat table df <- data.frame(rowid = numeric(),                  user = character(),                  text = character(),                  time = double()) dbWriteTable(conn, "chat_data", df) ui <- fluidPage(   chat_ui("test") )  server <- function(input, output, server) {   chat_server("test", db_connection = conn,               db_table_name = "chat_data",               chat_user = "user1") }  # Run the application shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

previous_headings: Database connection for storing chat data
title: Getting started with shinyChatR
text: example show user name can stored reactive. user specifies name textInput field. , server user name save reactive user_rv. reactive can passed argument chat_user.
code: ui <- fluidPage(    fluidRow(     column(width = 6,            # Here the user specifies the user name            textInput("user", "Enter User Name"),            br(),            # add chat ui elements            chat_ui("test_reactive"),     )   ) ) server <- function(input, output, server) {    # save user name in reactive   user_rv <- reactive({input$user})    # corresponding server part for id test_reactive   chat_server("test_reactive", db_connection = conn,               db_table_name = "chat_data",               chat_user = user_rv   ) }

what: RDS file for storing chat data
title: Getting started with shinyChatR
text: Also rds file first needs initialized. Now can add chat module app:
code: df <- data.frame(rowid = numeric(),                  user = character(),                  text = character(),                  time = double())  test_rds <- "path_to_rds_file.rds" saveRDS(df, test_rds) test_rds <- "path_to_rds_file.rds"  ui <- fluidPage(   chat_ui("test2") )  server <- function(input, output, server) {   chat_server("test2",                rds_path = test_rds,               chat_user = "user2") }  # Run the application shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
